definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Success will not turn my head.
sentences.chinese: 胜利不会让我头脑发昏。

sentences.english: I cannot complain when you frazzle my brain.
sentences.chinese: 当你使我头脑发昏，我也不抱怨你。

sentences.english: Your whole head is injured, your whole heart afflicted.
sentences.chinese: 你们已经满头疼痛，全心发昏。

sentences.english: Greediness had made them loose their minds and not see the obviousness of the trick being played on them.
sentences.chinese: 贪婪让他们头脑发昏不能意识到自己正被欺骗。

sentences.english: No longer the lightest word of a man made her head dizzy.
sentences.chinese: 她不再会被男人一句无足轻重的话弄得头脑发昏。

sentences.english: You must be crazy to go walking in such awful weather.
sentences.chinese: 你一定是头脑发昏了，这么恶劣的天气还要去散步。

sentences.english: Lie down and shut your eyes: you're wandering.
Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.
He made me desolate, faint all the day long.
Other research suggests that high stakes can befuddle the brain .
sentences.chinese: 另一项研究显示，高度的利害关系会让人头脑发昏。

sentences.english: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.
sentences.chinese: 这些事我们心里发昏，我们的眼睛昏花。

sentences.english: In that day shall the fair virgins and young men faint for thirst.
sentences.chinese: 当那日，美貌的处女，和少年的男子，必因干渴发昏。

definition: to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
swelling of the head (physical condition)/fig. swellheaded/conceited
variant of 頭昏腦脹|头昏脑胀[tou2 hun1 nao3 zhang4]
variant of 頭暈腦脹|头晕脑胀[tou2 yun1 nao3 zhang4]
to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
